children.value: This is the coolest feature and one of the main reasons that
array, allows you to set different
for different sizes of the element, regardless to the window's size.
This is due to the fact that
You can pass an array of objects that will signal
Drag or use the resize buttons to see the changes...

<Playground >
  {
    class App extends React.Component{
      constructor(props){
        super(props);
        this.breakPoints = [
          { width: 1, itemsToShow: 1 },
          { width: 550, itemsToShow: 2, itemsToScroll: 2 },
          { width: 850, itemsToShow: 3 },
          { width: 1150, itemsToShow: 4, itemsToScroll: 2 },
          { width: 1450, itemsToShow: 5 },
          { width: 1750, itemsToShow: 6 }
        ];
      }
      render(){
        return(
          <Carousel breakPoints={this.breakPoints}>
            <Item>1</Item>
            <Item>2</Item>
            <Item>3</Item>
            <Item>4</Item>
            <Item>5</Item>
            <Item>6</Item>
          </Carousel>
        );
      }
    }
  }
</Playground>
